channel.title: Optimizing Java for Speed
channel.description:
[url=http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~jch/java/speed.html]http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~jch/java/speed.html[/url]
You were probably waiting for a more personal topic, but why write it again if there's already one..? It might be from the stone age ('98), but most of it still holds, even though HotSpot does a bit of optimization nowadays.
The native parts and replacing API classes sound a bit dirty, so I wouldn't recommend them. :|

item.title: Optimizing Java for Speed
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

No, actually the -o tag has been deprecated and the only automatic optimization is done by HotSpot.

Read full topic

item.title: Optimizing Java for Speed
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

I don’t know if this is still valid, but compiling with the -o tage might do a bit of compile-time optimization.

Read full topic
